metadata.name: AppVeyorManifestPS
metadata.title: Catesta - PSModule template for AppVeyor
metadata.description: Scaffolds a new PowerShell module project intended for CI/CD workflow using AppVeyor
metadata.author: Jake Morrison

parameter.name: ModuleName
parameter.prompt: Enter the name of the module

parameter.name: Description
parameter.prompt: Enter a description for the module

parameter.name: Version
parameter.prompt: Enter the version number of the module

parameter.name: Changelog
parameter.prompt: Would you like to generate a Changelog file?

choice.label: &Changelog
choice.help: Adds a Changelog file.

choice.label: &None
choice.help: Does not add a Changelog file.

parameter.name: RepoType
parameter.prompt: Would you like to generate helpful GitHub templates? (issue/pullrequest/feature)

choice.label: &GitHub
choice.help: Adds GitHub templates.

choice.label: &None
choice.help: Does not add GitHub templates.

parameter.name: License
parameter.prompt: Select a License for your module. (Help deciding: https://choosealicense.com/)

choice.label: &MIT
choice.help: Adds a MIT License file.

choice.label: &Apache
choice.help: Adds an Apache License file.

choice.label: &GNU
choice.help: Adds a GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE file.

choice.label: &ISC
choice.help: Adds an ISC License file.

choice.label: &None
choice.help: Does not add a License file.

parameter.name: COC
parameter.prompt: Would you like to generate a Code of Conduct file?

choice.label: &conduct
choice.help: Adds a Code of Conduct file.

choice.label: &None
choice.help: Does not add a Changelog file.

parameter.name: Contribute
parameter.prompt: Would you like to generate a Contributing guidelines file?

choice.label: &Contribute
choice.help: Adds a Contributing file.

choice.label: &None
choice.help: Does not add a Contributing file.

parameter.name: CodingStyle
parameter.prompt: Would you like to specify a coding style for the project?

choice.label: &Stroustrup
choice.help: Sets Stroustrup as the preferred coding style.

choice.label: &OTBS
choice.help: Sets OTBS as the preferred coding style.

choice.label: &Allman
choice.help: Sets Allman as the preferred coding style.

choice.label: &None
choice.help: No coding style is set for the project.

parameter.name: Help
parameter.prompt: Would you like to use platyPS to generate help documentation files for your project?

choice.label: &Yes
choice.help: platyPS will generate MarkDown help and external xml help

choice.label: &No
choice.help: No help files will be generated.

parameter.name: Options
parameter.prompt: Select desired pipeline job configurations. (If your module is cross-platform you should select multiple)

choice.label: &Windows - PowerShell
choice.help: Adds a Windows PowerShell AppVeyor task.

choice.label: &Core (Windows)- pwsh
choice.help: Adds a Windows pwsh AppVeyor task.

choice.label: &Linux
choice.help: Adds a Linux AppVeyor task.

choice.label: &MacOS
choice.help: Adds a MacOS AppVeyor task.

content.message: Scaffolding your PowerShell Module for GitHub Actions...

requireModule.name: Pester
requireModule.message: Without Pester, you will not be able to run the provided Pester test to validate your module manifest file.`nWithout version 4.5.0, VS Code will not display Pester warnings and errors in the Problems panel.

requireModule.name: InvokeBuild
requireModule.message: Without InvokeBuild, you will not be able to run local builds.

requireModule.name: platyPS
requireModule.message: This template requires platyPS v0.12.0 module to properly generate help.

content.message: Your new PowerShell module project '$PLASTER_PARAM_ModuleName' has been created.

Several Pester tests have been created to validate various components of the module. Add additional tests to the test directory. If using VSCode you can run the Pester tests in your project by executing the 'test' task. Press Ctrl+P, then type 'task TestLocal'. Other build related tasks are also available. Press Ctrl+P, then type 'task' and press space. You will see a list of available build tasks.

An AppVeyor file has been generated for this project. You can find it in the root folder. This will run automatically after your configure your repository with AppVeyor integration. More information: https://github.com/techthoughts2/Catesta/blob/master/docs/Catesta-AppVeyor.md
